definitions.definition: A sequence of real or fictional events; or, an account of such a sequence.
definitions.example: The book tells the story of two roommates.
You’ve been telling stories again, haven’t you?
What will she do without being able to watch her stories?

definitions.definition: A sequence of events, or a situation, such as might be related in an account.
definitions.example: I tried it again; same story, no error message, nothing happened.

definitions.definition: A chronological collection of pictures or short videos published by a user on an application or website that is typically only available for a short period.
To tell as a story; to relate or narrate about.
A floor or level of a building or ship.
definitions.example: For superstitious reasons, many buildings number their 13th storey as 14, bypassing 13 entirely.

definitions.definition: A vertical level in certain letters, such as a and g.
definitions.example: The IPA symbol for a voiced velar stop is the single-storey , not the double-storey .

definitions.definition: A floor or level of a building; a storey.
definitions.example: Our shop was on the fourth story of the building, so we had to install an elevator.
